qas.question: How do most people describe the relationship with their dogs?
What television show uses a dominance model of dog and human relationships?
Most people today describe their dogs as what?
What TV show promotes a dominance model for the relationships people have with their dogs?

context: The majority of contemporary people with dogs describe their pet as <a0_0><a2_0>part of the family<a2_0/><a0_0/>, although some ambivalence about the relationship is evident in the popular reconceptualization of the dog–human family as a pack. A dominance model of dog–human relationships has been promoted by some dog trainers, such as on the television program <a1_0><a3_0>Dog Whisperer<a3_0/>.<a1_0/> However it has been disputed that "trying to achieve status" is characteristic of dog–human interactions. Pet dogs play an active role in family life; for example, a study of conversations in dog–human families showed how family members use the dog as a resource, talking to the dog, or talking through the dog, to mediate their interactions with each other.
